meanings.definition: To make (an object or area) safe by removing or neutralizing harmful substances
meanings.sent1: The hazmat team worked quickly to decontaminate the spill.
meanings.sent2: After the flood, they had to decontaminate the basement to ensure it was safe.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's special power was to decontaminate any danger with a touch.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to decontaminate the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays helped to decontaminate the polluted water, making it crystal clear.

meanings.definition: To cleanse or purify (something) from impurities or pollutants
meanings.sent1: The water treatment plant uses chemicals to decontaminate the drinking water.
meanings.sent2: She used a special soap to decontaminate her hands after gardening.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to decontaminate the air in the spaceship.
meanings.sent4: His kind words seemed to decontaminate the negativity in the room.
meanings.sent5: The fresh air helped to decontaminate her mind from stress, leaving her feeling refreshed.
